14#ifndef NAMED_SERVER_H
15#define NAMED_SERVER_H 1
16
17/*! \file */
18
19#include <inttypes.h>
20#include <stdbool.h>
21
22#include <isc/log.h>
23#include <isc/magic.h>
24#include <isc/quota.h>
25#include <isc/sockaddr.h>
26#include <isc/types.h>
27#include <isc/xml.h>
28
29#include <dns/acl.h>
30#include <dns/dnstap.h>
31#include <dns/stats.h>
32#include <dns/types.h>
33
34#include <ns/interfacemgr.h>
35#include <ns/server.h>
36#include <ns/stats.h>
37#include <ns/types.h>
38
39#include <named/types.h>
40
41#define NAMED_EVENTCLASS ISC_EVENTCLASS(0x4E43)
42#define NAMED_EVENT_RELOAD (NAMED_EVENTCLASS + 0)
43#define NAMED_EVENT_DELZONE (NAMED_EVENTCLASS + 1)
44
45/*%
46 * Name server state. Better here than in lots of separate global variables.
47 */
48struct named_server {
49 unsigned int magic;
50 isc_mem_t * mctx;
51
52 ns_server_t * sctx;
53
54 isc_task_t * task;
55
56 char * statsfile; /*%< Statistics file name */
57 char * dumpfile; /*%< Dump file name */
58 char * secrootsfile; /*%< Secroots file name */
59 char * bindkeysfile; /*%< bind.keys file name */
60 char * recfile; /*%< Recursive file name */
61 bool version_set; /*%< User has set version */
62 char * version; /*%< User-specified version */
63 bool hostname_set; /*%< User has set hostname */
64 char * hostname; /*%< User-specified hostname */
65
66 /* Server data structures. */
67 dns_loadmgr_t * loadmgr;
68 dns_zonemgr_t * zonemgr;
69 dns_viewlist_t viewlist;
70 ns_interfacemgr_t * interfacemgr;
71 dns_db_t * in_roothints;
72
73 isc_timer_t * interface_timer;
74 isc_timer_t * heartbeat_timer;
75 isc_timer_t * pps_timer;
76 isc_timer_t * tat_timer;
77
78 uint32_t interface_interval;
79 uint32_t heartbeat_interval;
80
81 isc_mutex_t reload_event_lock;
82 isc_event_t * reload_event;
83 bool reload_in_progress;
84
85 bool flushonshutdown;
86
87 named_cachelist_t cachelist; /*%< Possibly shared caches */
88 isc_stats_t * zonestats; /*% Zone management stats */
89 isc_stats_t * resolverstats; /*% Resolver stats */
90 isc_stats_t * sockstats; /*%< Socket stats */
91
92 named_controls_t * controls; /*%< Control channels */
93 unsigned int dispatchgen;
94 named_dispatchlist_t dispatches;
95
96 named_statschannellist_t statschannels;
97
98 dns_tsigkey_t *sessionkey;
99 char *session_keyfile;
100 dns_name_t *session_keyname;
101 unsigned int session_keyalg;
102 uint16_t session_keybits;
103 bool interface_auto;
104 unsigned char secret[32]; /*%< Server Cookie Secret */
105 ns_cookiealg_t cookiealg;
106
107 dns_dtenv_t *dtenv; /*%< Dnstap environment */
108
109 char * lockfile;
110};
111
112#define NAMED_SERVER_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('S','V','E','R')
113#define NAMED_SERVER_VALID(s) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(s, NAMED_SERVER_MAGIC)
114
115void
116named_server_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, named_server_t **serverp);
117/*%<
118 * Create a server object with default settings.
119 * This function either succeeds or causes the program to exit
120 * with a fatal error.
121 */
122
123void
124named_server_destroy(named_server_t **serverp);
125/*%<
126 * Destroy a server object, freeing its memory.
127 */
128
129void
130named_server_reloadwanted(named_server_t *server);
131/*%<
132 * Inform a server that a reload is wanted. This function
133 * may be called asynchronously, from outside the server's task.
134 * If a reload is already scheduled or in progress, the call
135 * is ignored.
136 */
137
138void
139named_server_scan_interfaces(named_server_t *server);
140/*%<
141 * Trigger a interface scan.
142 * Must only be called when running under server->task.
143 */
144
145void
146named_server_flushonshutdown(named_server_t *server, bool flush);
147/*%<
148 * Inform the server that the zones should be flushed to disk on shutdown.
149 */
150
151isc_result_t
152named_server_reloadcommand(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex,
153 isc_buffer_t **text);
154/*%<
155 * Act on a "reload" command from the command channel.
156 */
157
158isc_result_t
159named_server_reconfigcommand(named_server_t *server);
160/*%<
161 * Act on a "reconfig" command from the command channel.
162 */
163
164isc_result_t
165named_server_notifycommand(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex,
166 isc_buffer_t **text);
167/*%<
168 * Act on a "notify" command from the command channel.
169 */
170
171isc_result_t
172named_server_refreshcommand(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex,
173 isc_buffer_t **text);
174/*%<
175 * Act on a "refresh" command from the command channel.
176 */
177
178isc_result_t
179named_server_retransfercommand(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex,
180 isc_buffer_t **text);
181/*%<
182 * Act on a "retransfer" command from the command channel.
183 */
184
185isc_result_t
186named_server_togglequerylog(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex);
187/*%<
188 * Enable/disable logging of queries. (Takes "yes" or "no" argument,
189 * but can also be used as a toggle for backward comptibility.)
190 */
191
192/*%
193 * Save the current NTAs for all views to files.
194 */
195isc_result_t
196named_server_saventa(named_server_t *server);
197
198/*%
199 * Load NTAs for all views from files.
200 */
201isc_result_t
202named_server_loadnta(named_server_t *server);
203
204/*%
205 * Dump the current statistics to the statistics file.
206 */
207isc_result_t
208named_server_dumpstats(named_server_t *server);
209
210/*%
211 * Dump the current cache to the dump file.
212 */
213isc_result_t
214named_server_dumpdb(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex,
215 isc_buffer_t **text);
216
217/*%
218 * Dump the current security roots to the secroots file.
219 */
220isc_result_t
221named_server_dumpsecroots(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex,
222 isc_buffer_t **text);
223
224/*%
225 * Change or increment the server debug level.
226 */
227isc_result_t
228named_server_setdebuglevel(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex);
229
230/*%
231 * Flush the server's cache(s)
232 */
233isc_result_t
234named_server_flushcache(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex);
235
236/*%
237 * Flush a particular name from the server's cache. If 'tree' is false,
238 * also flush the name from the ADB and badcache. If 'tree' is true, also
239 * flush all the names under the specified name.
240 */
241isc_result_t
242named_server_flushnode(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex,
243 bool tree);
244
245/*%
246 * Report the server's status.
247 */
248isc_result_t
249named_server_status(named_server_t *server, isc_buffer_t **text);
250
251/*%
252 * Report a list of dynamic and static tsig keys, per view.
253 */
254isc_result_t
255named_server_tsiglist(named_server_t *server, isc_buffer_t **text);
256
257/*%
258 * Delete a specific key (with optional view).
259 */
260isc_result_t
261named_server_tsigdelete(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex,
262 isc_buffer_t **text);
263
264/*%
265 * Enable or disable updates for a zone.
266 */
267isc_result_t
268named_server_freeze(named_server_t *server, bool freeze,
269 isc_lex_t *lex, isc_buffer_t **text);
270
271/*%
272 * Dump zone updates to disk, optionally removing the journal file
273 */
274isc_result_t
275named_server_sync(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex, isc_buffer_t **text);
276
277/*%
278 * Update a zone's DNSKEY set from the key repository. If
279 * the command that triggered the call to this function was "sign",
280 * then force a full signing of the zone. If it was "loadkeys",
281 * then don't sign the zone; any needed changes to signatures can
282 * take place incrementally.
283 */
284isc_result_t
285named_server_rekey(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex, isc_buffer_t **text);
286
287/*%
288 * Dump the current recursive queries.
289 */
290isc_result_t
291named_server_dumprecursing(named_server_t *server);
292
293/*%
294 * Maintain a list of dispatches that require reserved ports.
295 */
296void
297named_add_reserved_dispatch(named_server_t *server, const isc_sockaddr_t *addr);
298
299/*%
300 * Enable or disable dnssec validation.
301 */
302isc_result_t
303named_server_validation(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex,
304 isc_buffer_t **text);
305
306/*%
307 * Add a zone to a running process, or modify an existing zone
308 */
309isc_result_t
310named_server_changezone(named_server_t *server, char *command,
311 isc_buffer_t **text);
312
313/*%
314 * Deletes a zone from a running process
315 */
316isc_result_t
317named_server_delzone(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex,
318 isc_buffer_t **text);
319
320/*%
321 * Show current configuration for a given zone
322 */
323isc_result_t
324named_server_showzone(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex,
325 isc_buffer_t **text);
326
327/*%
328 * Lists the status of the signing records for a given zone.
329 */
330isc_result_t
331named_server_signing(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex,
332 isc_buffer_t **text);
333
334/*%
335 * Lists status information for a given zone (e.g., name, type, files,
336 * load time, expiry, etc).
337 */
338isc_result_t
339named_server_zonestatus(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex,
340 isc_buffer_t **text);
341
342/*%
343 * Adds/updates a Negative Trust Anchor (NTA) for a specified name and
344 * duration, in a particular view if specified, or in all views.
345 */
346isc_result_t
347named_server_nta(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex,
348 bool readonly, isc_buffer_t **text);
349
350/*%
351 * Generates a test sequence that is only for use in system tests. The
352 * argument is the size of required output in bytes.
353 */
354isc_result_t
355named_server_testgen(isc_lex_t *lex, isc_buffer_t **text);
356
357/*%
358 * Force fefresh or print status for managed keys zones.
359 */
360isc_result_t
361named_server_mkeys(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex, isc_buffer_t **text);
362
363/*%
364 * Close and reopen DNSTAP output file.
365 */
366isc_result_t
367named_server_dnstap(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex,
368 isc_buffer_t **text);
369
370/*%
371 * Display or update tcp-{initial,idle,keepalive,advertised}-timeout options.
372 */
373isc_result_t
374named_server_tcptimeouts(isc_lex_t *lex, isc_buffer_t **text);
375
376/*%
377 * Control whether stale answers are served or not when configured in
378 * named.conf.
379 */
380isc_result_t
381named_server_servestale(named_server_t *server, isc_lex_t *lex,
382 isc_buffer_t **text);
383
384#endif /* NAMED_SERVER_H */
385
